VulnerabilityDesc.Description: An unclaimed npm package and scope can allow an attacker to upload malicious code under that unclaimed package, resulting in achieving remote code execution on developers/users' machine who depends on the timeswap repository to build it on local env.
The 'excess' variable is underflown due to the wrong initialization of the variable, which can cause unexpected behaviors for users.
An attacker can keep doing a DOS attack on every user that repays his full debt by frontrunning to repay a single token for his debt, which can negatively impact the protocol availability.
The wrong timing of check allows users to withdraw collateral without paying for the debt, which can result in stealing the collateral.
VulnerabilityDesc.Repair: Change the order of the code
